meanings.definition: Of or relating to a peak or summit.
meanings.sent1: The mountain climber reached the pical peak after a long journey.
meanings.sent2: The tall tree had a pical shape at the very top.
meanings.sent3: The pical view from the top of the tower took their breath away.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement reached a pical level when she won the race.
meanings.sent5: The sun setting behind the mountains created a pical silhouette.

meanings.sent1: The pointed hat had a pical shape that reminded her of a mountain top.
meanings.sent2: The roof of the house had a pical design that mimicked a peak.
meanings.sent3: The pical hairstyle made her look taller than she actually was.
meanings.sent4: His voice reached a pical pitch when he sang the high notes.
meanings.sent5: The cake was decorated with pical swirls that looked like mountain peaks.

meanings.sent1: The hiker finally reached the pical of the mountain and enjoyed the view.
meanings.sent2: The thermometer showed the pical temperature of the day.
meanings.sent3: The competition reached its pical when the finalists were announced.
meanings.sent4: Her achievement in the competition was the pical of her career.
meanings.sent5: The pical of the roller coaster ride was the thrilling drop.
